channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: "私募股权》是一本关于在残酷、高风险的顶级对冲基金世界工作的新回忆录。点击此处阅读节选。
item.description:
"Private Equity" is a new memoir about working in the cutthroat, high-risk world of top hedge funds. Read an excerpt here. https://t.co/7ihexICw8F https://t.co/7ihexICw8F

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 从月光酒到葡萄酒庄更年长、更富裕的人口涌入阿巴拉契亚，把一个乡村地区变成了热闹的退休天堂。
item.description:
From moonshine to wineries. An older, wealthier population is flooding into Appalachia, transforming a rustic region into a bustling retirement haven. https://t.co/skNb1WnXT4 https://t.co/skNb1WnXT4

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 巴塞罗那椅伊姆斯休闲椅和长椅。经典，但过于夸张，被无情地淘汰，令人疲倦。是时候考虑一下这些设计师认可的、同样别致的替代品了。
item.description:
The Barcelona Chair. The Eames Lounge Chair and Ottoman. Classic, but overexposed, relentlessly knocked-off and just tired. It's time to consider one of these designer-approved, equally chic alternatives. https://t.co/Khz1UO1kSs https://t.co/Khz1UO1kSs

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 为了了解 500 万美元在退休生活中能买到什么，我们采访了全国各地拥有这个数字储蓄的退休人员。在这里，他们畅谈了自己的财务生活以及如何花费时间和金钱。
item.description:
To find out what $5 million buys in retirement, we spoke to retirees around the country with savings in that ballpark. Here, they open up about their financial lives and how they spend their time and money. https://t.co/65KcvboRWZ https://t.co/65KcvboRWZ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 当美国和欧洲为基辅的武器问题争论不休时，一个前苏联卫星国正求助于冷战时期的关系，以帮助乌克兰抵御俄罗斯的进攻
item.description:
While the U.S. and Europe argue over weapons for Kyiv, one former Soviet satellite state is turning to Cold War contacts to help Ukraine hold back Russia https://t.co/qHCI3HVjzo https://t.co/qHCI3HVjzo

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 虽然印度的投资者不会面临中国那样的打击，但新德里管理风险的举措也会对公司产生巨大影响
item.description:
While investors in India don’t face the kinds of crackdowns seen in China, New Delhi’s moves to manage risk can also have a big impact on companies https://t.co/mA8mYP2MC4 https://t.co/mA8mYP2MC4

item.title: 由于食品价格不断上涨，在苹果蜂餐厅（Applebee's）晚餐约会是美国餐饮业最热门的门票之一。但是，一张价值 1500 美元的餐厅每周用餐的稀有通行证，却让厌倦了通货膨胀的食客们一见倾心。
item.description:
A dinner date at Applebee's is one of the hottest tickets in American dining, thanks to escalating food prices. But a rare pass for $1,500 worth of weekly meals at the restaurant became an instant hit for inflation-weary diners. https://t.co/3t4Z2RzF1u https://t.co/3t4Z2RzF1u

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 自纽约市打击短租以来，纽约市的旅游环境发生了根本性的变化。纽约市 Airbnbs 上列出的短期租房数量从 8 月份的约 21500 套下降到 2 月份的约 3280 套。
item.description:
The travel landscape in New York City has changed fundamentally since its crackdown on short-term rentals. The number of short-term units listed on NYC Airbnbs dropped from about 21,500 in August to about 3,280 in February. https://t.co/30XSAqkc2G https://t.co/30XSAqkc2G

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: "新面貌》讲述了迪奥和香奈儿在纳粹占领下的巴黎的故事，是最近一波电影和电视节目中的最新一部，聚焦于塑造奢侈时尚的悲剧和不法行为。
item.description:
“The New Look,” about Dior and Chanel in Nazi-occupied Paris, is the latest in a recent wave of movies and television shows focused on the tragedy and wrongdoing that has shaped luxury fashion https://t.co/PAy8lXeHBD https://t.co/PAy8lXeHBD

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：当政客们告诉我们必须 "遵循科学 "来制定极端的气候政策时，他们实际上是在试图阻止我们讨论巨大的、不可持续的成本。我们不应该让他们得逞，@BjornLomborg 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: When politicians tell us we must “follow the science” toward extreme climate policies, they are really trying to shut down the discussion of enormous, unsustainable costs. We shouldn’t let them, writes @BjornLomborg. https://t.co/xyvK621CXA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：对新日铁的政治反对与经济利益无关。这与克利夫兰-克里夫斯公司、钢铁工人工会以及 11 月份蓝领工人的选举竞争有关。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The political opposition to Nippon Steel isn’t about the economic merits. It’s about Cleveland-Cliffs, the steelworkers union and the electoral competition for blue-collar workers in November.https://t.co/IgzEBtPy17

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：今年的总统选举，美国公众需要的是一场有理有据的选举。相反，法律机会主义可能会投下最大的一票，@DanHenninger 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The American public needed a presidential election this year on the merits. Instead, legal opportunism may cast the biggest vote, writes @DanHenninger.https://t.co/dLcwwlQ5hy

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: Todd Snyder 发现，男士们需要适合工作的服装，但他们也会偶尔放纵一下。这一理念推动他的品牌走向成功。
item.description:
Todd Snyder saw that men wanted palatable, work-appropriate clothes, but they also indulge on occasion. That thesis has propelled his brand to success. https://t.co/uV6chWpdXf https://t.co/uV6chWpdXf

item.title: "Girls5Eva》主演 Busy Philipps 谈及自己小时候的怪癖："我有很强的主见，很容易迷恋自己喜欢的东西，这让其他孩子感到焦虑，他们希望我像他们一样--安静、酷。
item.description:
"Girls5Eva" star Busy Philipps on embracing her weirdness as a kid: "I had strong opinions and easily became obsessed with things I liked, which caused anxiety in other kids who wanted me to be like them—quiet and cool." https://t.co/73Kucvpvpq https://t.co/73Kucvpvpq

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 拳击手奥斯卡-德拉霍亚（Oscar De La Hoya）在拉斯维加斯再下一城--这一次，他将在拉斯维加斯建造一座豪华住宅，其中包括一个价值 40 万美元的私人洞穴和一个向其职业生涯致敬的房间。
item.description:
Boxer Oscar De La Hoya is going another round with Las Vegas—this time with a tricked out home with features like a $400,000 man cave and a tribute room that pays homage to his career https://t.co/eZOmiuILWa https://t.co/eZOmiuILWa

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 深夜节目主持人吉米-法伦（Jimmy Fallon）一直在等待谈论他的护肤程序。"从来没有人问过我，"他说。"我一直在求别人问我"
item.description:
Late-night host Jimmy Fallon has been waiting to talk about his skin care routine. “No one’s ever asked me,” he said. “I’ve been begging for someone to.” https://t.co/HShWWPHVmL https://t.co/HShWWPHVmL

item.title: 十年前，在比弗利伍德花二三十万美元就能买到一栋房子。现在呢？"你不可能以低于300万美元的价格买到任何一条黄金街道上的地皮"。
